concept.title: HTML Layout Pages
concept.shortdesc: HTML Layout Pages represent an important component involved by the WebHelp generation process. They are simple HTML templates defining the layout of the generated pages.

conbody.p: The template descriptor allows you to specify the HTML Layout Pages using the html-page-templates element:
conbody.codeblock: <publishing-template> ... <webhelp> ... <!-- HTML page templates --> <html-page-templates> <page-template page="main" file="page-templates/wt_index.html"/> <page-template page="search" file="page-templates/wt_search.html"/> <page-template page="topic" file="page-templates/wt_topic.html"/> <page-template page="index-terms" file="page-templates/wt_terms.html"/> </html-page-templates>
conbody.p: Each of the HTML Layout Page contain one or more components (such as title, table of contents, search input, etc.) whose placement inside the template will define the final layout of the output.
This mechanism allows you to create multiple layouts by simply creating templates, each template defines different location for components.
conbody.note: The HTML Layout Pages are not required to be specified in a . In this case, the files from the /oxygen-webhelp/page-templates folder will be used.

If you want to specify the HTML page templates in a publishing template it is necessarily to specify all of them: topic, search, main page and index terms. In other words, you are not allowed to specify only a single HTML page template.
